entries.message: You catch the report on the breach?
Yeah. And it’s not just a breach, John. Someone walked right through our firewalls like they owned the place.
How the hell is that possible? We’ve got three air-gapped layers and a kill switch.
That’s what scares me. Whoever did this… they knew our system inside out. This wasn’t some kid in a basement.
Classified dossiers. Black sites, off-books operations, names of assets. Basically, everything that can get people killed.
Shit… That’s the whole damn playbook. Does Command know?
Not yet. I wanted to warn you first. The login they used was yours.
Your ID, your clearance level, your timestamp. To anyone looking at the logs, it’s gonna look like you sold us out.
That’s bullshit and you know it. Someone’s framing me.
I know. But Command won’t see it that way. They’ve been itching for an excuse to burn you ever since Moscow.
Then we need to get ahead of this before they pin it on me. Who else had access to my credentials?
No one… unless you count the ghost accounts. Shadow operatives that don’t officially exist. Ring any bells?
Yeah. Ghost Division. Christ… if they’re active again, this is bigger than we thought.
Bigger and bloodier. I traced the signal — it bounced through six countries, all dead drops. Whoever did this is covering their tracks in real time.
Alright. Sit tight, scrub the backups, and burn every trace of this call. If they’re listening, we’re already fucked.
John… if they’re framing you, they’re coming for me next. You know that, right?
Yeah. Keep a gun handy, Sarah. We’re in the deep end now.
